meanings.definition: The quality of being acceptable or agreeable to the taste; tastiness.
meanings.sent1: The palatableness of the soup made it a favorite among the children.
meanings.sent2: The palatableness of the dish pleased even the pickiest eaters.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret to success was enhancing the palatableness of his creations.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a palatableness that soothed the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The palatableness of the chocolate cake was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being agreeable or acceptable; pleasantness.
meanings.sent1: The palatableness of the music brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent2: The palatableness of the weather made it a perfect day for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The palatableness of the joke had everyone laughing for hours.
meanings.sent4: His kindness had a palatableness that touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The palatableness of the flowers in the garden was a delight to behold.
